primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God intervenes in the hopeless state of human 'deadness' and 'helplessness' through the death of Christ to reconcile and make alive those who were enemies.

subject.identificatie: God (specifically the Father in sending and Christ in the performance of the Cross)
tekstueel_bewijs: God... made us alive together with Christ
He has written our death sentence in his own blood

object.identificatie: Reconciliation, Life, and the 'Drawing near' of humanity
tekstueel_bewijs: made us alive together with Christ
brought near in the blood of Christ
God, who is rich in mercy, out of the great love with which he loved us
you who once were far off
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: Receiver (specifically the 'incompetent' receiver who cannot act)

helper.identificatie: The Blood of Christ / The Cross
tekstueel_bewijs: brought near in the blood of Christ
the Cross is the inner criterion
helper.rol_van_god: God is both Subject and the means of Help (Christ as Mediator)
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicitly the power that makes the 'dead' alive

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Death, the Devil, and the 'Self-Help' delusion
tekstueel_bewijs: the prince of the power of the air
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad behavior but ontological 'deadness' and a 'prince' of power that requires a divine subject to overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The hearer, having been saved, now stands at the foot of the cross to represent the world and witness to the truth.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer (as a 'Christlike' witness)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program of 'standing at the cross' is only possible because the primary program of 'making alive' has occurred.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: The Blood of Christ → God/Christ ← Sin/Death/Satan

voorbeelden_god_subject: He submitted to that sentence on our behalf
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we seek to enter into the meaning

voorbeelden: we should not think of this as a characteristic
we desire with a single-minded intention
we begin perhaps to see how the Son of God has entered
he has written our death sentence in his own blood

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the total lack of human 'pouvoir' (power) and the absolute 'pouvoir' of God. It is a theology of enablement through divine performance.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the false security of ~S1 (Self-help) to the crushing reality of S2/ ~S2 (Deadness/Helplessness), then the 'But God' pivot to S1 (Grace).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by Christ taking the 'death sentence' (S2) so the receiver can move to S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; death is described as 'unspeakable ugliness' and 'deadness'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon explicitly attacks the 'Self-Help' (anthropocentric) model and replaces it with a 'But God' (theocentric) model where the human is the passive recipient of life.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: In a very important sense, therefore, you are doing something Christlike

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He became the judge judged in our place.
following the prince of the power of the air

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The preacher explicitly rejects imitation of a hero.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: None (Jesus is specifically NOT an 'innocent hero whom we might some day emulate')

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and gratitude; the 'crucifixion' of the burden of self-improvement.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation; God alone acts to save.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative logic is perfectly maintained: Human inability → Divine intervention → Resulting gratitude.
spanning_punten: The transition from 'helpless' to 'doing something Christlike' by being at the service is the only slight tension.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: he submitted to that sentence on our behalf - so that it would not fall on us.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses on the work of the Son and Father; the Spirit is the implicit 'making alive' power.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in maintaining God as the Subject. It systematically deconstructs the hearer as Subject ('Self-Help') and reconstructs them as Receiver.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is for Good Friday
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The lack of 'Devoir' is appropriate for a sermon focusing on the finished work of Christ.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon successfully avoids the 'Exemplarist' trap of Good Friday and maintains a strict 'Grammar of Grace' by keeping God as the active Subject of all redemptive verbs.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'But God' pivot as a stylistic device; Greimassian analysis sees it as a fundamental Actantial shift from Human-as-Subject to God-as-Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Greek of Ephesians; this analysis shows how the sermon's 'engine' actually functions to deliver grace to the hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Self-Help' being crucified is not just a theme, but the removal of the Hearer from the 'Subject' slot in the narrative structure.

volledige_subject_lijst: He has written our death sentence
appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'But God' pivot to perform a semiotic reversal of the human condition.
